utterances: There's one thing that everyone seems to believe: Confidence in the city's levees must be restored, or the future of New Orleans will remain in doubt.

Mcilwain says the federal government is the only player with the resources to cross that hurdle.

One concern Mcilwain does have about federal rebuilding funds is that when they arrive they'll go directly to individuals.

Mcilwain says funneling the rebuilding money through a government authority would allow the city to rebuild in a way that could include low-income residents whose neighborhoods might end up being abandoned.

Utt says past government attempts at urban renewal provide a cautionary tale.
